III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12312 Foster parent training
• (4) At least 1 adult member of the household must
have training in and maintain a current certification
in first aid and cardiopulmonary resuscitation from
the American Heart Association or the American
Red Cross, or other institution approved by the
department.
One of three licensing files reviewed did not have a certificate from American Heart
Association or the American Red Cross for CPR.
FOM POLICY 722-08D Treatment plans – Agreement and Signatures
• Once completed and approved the caseworker must obtain signatures
from the following individuals, as applicable:
Caseworker, Supervisor, second line supervisor, when siblings in care are
place apart, parents who are a member of a participating household.
Youth ages 14 and older. Foster parents, relative caregivers, and
unrelated court – ordered caregivers. Parents/legal guardians, youth, and
caregivers must check yes or no for the following when signing the
2

treatment plan: I have participated in the Development of the Case service
plan and Parent Agency Treatment Plan.
Two of three foster care files reviewed were either missing signatures, signatures
were obtained after 30 days and yes or no were not checked on the PATP’s.
Repeat Violation Established
2023 Renewal, CAP approved 5/8/2023.

VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during
this licensing period, and compliance with the individual CAP is as follows: The
agency submitted an acceptable corrective action plan in response to the renewal
inspection completed on 5/11/23 with the corrective action plan approved on
5/11/2023. The agency received a citation with rules 400.12418, FOM Policy 722-
08D and FOM Policy 801-03. The agency continues to struggle in the area of
policy 722-08D as there is a repeat violation during this reporting period for this
policy.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was discussed onsite 03/12/2024. The Chief
Administrator (CA) reported the agency has not had any staff turnover since the
3

last audit review and has hired two foster care managers. The biggest challenge
is providing extra support to the newly hired staff by the supervisors. The CA
reported the agency has accepted 25 new cases since the last audit review and
almost all are relative caregivers who need extra support in order to maintain
placement. The CA reported the staff have been working diligently to maintain
relative placements and sometimes this takes precedence over data entry. The
CA reported overall, the corrective action plan submitted for the last audit
inspection has had a positive impact on the agency’s compliance as the trainings
and procedures that were put in place have proven to be beneficial to the agency.
Financial Overview
The agency provided a copy of their audit completed by an independent certified
accountant dated 12/31/2022 and presented to the agency on 5/22/2023. The
agency also presented their annual budget. No concerns were noted.
Staff Interviews
Interviews were conducted with three staff onsite. Staff reported feeling supported
by their supervisors, coworkers, and the administration. They all reported the
work environment is very positive, and they have no concerns. The only change
the staff reported was to be able to regulate the heat in the building.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency appears to have adequate space and equipment to perform required
job duties. Files are stored securely and in a manner that provides unauthorized
access.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Safety Alert: The home has an in-ground spa that does not have a locked safety
cover.
Resolution: A special evaluation #2024C0001343SE was opened regarding
R400.9301(5). A variance will be requested to allow the foster parent to maintain the
current cover while the spa is empty, as it is now. The current cover is very heavy
and requires a contractor to install and remove it. The foster parent also has motion-
activated alarms on all exterior doors and rescue equipment near the spa. The foster
parent will be required to obtain a cover with a lock to meet the licensing rule before
having the current cover removed and filling the spa with water. No children will be
placed in the home until the variance is approved or the foster parent is in
compliance with the licensing rule.
4

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
